get.summary: Get appointment channels for the currently logged in user
get.description:
Get available timeslots for the currently logged in user

This endpoint takes two optional parameters: `beginPeriod` and `endPeriod`. These two params form a pair, that means if one is specified, you need to specify the other.
In case you only provide one of these parameters, you'll receive a 400 bad request asking to provide the other parameter.

parameters.description: The territory ID selected.

parameters.description: The topic ID selected.

parameters.name: beginPeriod
parameters.description: The date from which you wanna book an appointment

parameters.name: endPeriod
parameters.description: The deadline for booking an appointment

get.summary: Get a client list by ID.
get.description:
Get a client list by ID.

**How to use pagination?**

If the request results size is larger than the provided `pageSize` value, `nextCursor` and  `totalNumberOfPages` will be added to the response object.

Assuming the following request returns more than the requested `(pageSize=200)` amount of results -

> `GET https://domain.com/path?pageSize=200&pageIndex=0`
> ```
> RESPONSE
> {
>   "status": "success",
>   "data": {
>     "source": "Example Plugin",
>     "actionId": "00000000",
>     "result": {
>       "clients": [
>         { ... }
>       ],
>       "totalNumberOfPages": 2,
>       "next_cursor": "01g5E00001Ned2tQAB"
>     }
>   }
> }
> ```
To paginate further results, the next request should specify the original's query page size, next page index and cursor -

> `GET https://domain.com/path?pageSize=200&pageIndex=1&cursor=01g5E00001Ned2tQAB`

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The list Id to use

put.description:
Update a client list. `memberIds` property can only *add* member Ids to an existing list, but can not remove them.

In a scenario where no `memberIds` were provided in request's body, the existing `memberIds` will not change.
If `memberIds` were provided in request's body, these memberIds will be added in addition to the existing memberIds list.

`memberIds` and `criteria` are incompatible with each other. Only one of them can exist in a request.

***-criteria*** attribute is currently not being used or have any implementation.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The list Id to use

delete.summary: Delete a client list by ID.
delete.description: Delete a client list by ID.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The list Id to use

get.summary: Get all clients.
get.description:
Get all clients.

**How to use pagination?**

If the request results size is larger than the provided `pageSize` value, `nextCursor` and  `totalNumberOfPages` will be added to the response object.

Assuming the following request returns more than the requested `(pageSize=200)` amount of results -

> `GET https://domain.com/path?pageSize=200&pageIndex=0`
> ```
> RESPONSE
> {
>   "status": "success",
>   "data": {
>     "source": "Example Plugin",
>     "actionId": "00000000",
>     "result": {
>       "clients": [
>         { ... }
>       ],
>       "totalNumberOfPages": 2,
>       "next_cursor": "01g5E00001Ned2tQAB"
>     }
>   }
> }
> ```
To paginate further results, the next request should specify the original's query page size, next page index and cursor -

> `GET https://domain.com/path?pageSize=200&pageIndex=1&cursor=01g5E00001Ned2tQAB`

get.summary: Get the list of all events.
get.description:
Get the list of all events.

There are several filters available at the moment.
Three of them (appointmentTopicId, appointmentChannel, storeId) can be applied only if the eventType is appointment.
In case you specify one of these three filters without passing eventType=Appointment as well, an error is thrown.

Note: If you consider sending multiple values for a single filter,
the recommend way to that is to separate them using a comma `,`.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: Filter to determine the type of the event

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filters used to refine the events retrieved.

```
filters = {
  filterKey1 : VALUE1,
  filterKey2 : VALUEA,VALUEB,VALUEC
}
```

The filterKeys are obtained from the result of the get filters query.

In case an array of values are provided with a filter,
the logical operation that will be apply is `Logical OR`

get.summary: Get the list of all available filters.
get.description: Return the list of all available filters

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description:
Filter to determine the filters that we should return.

Currently there's only one event type that is handled in SF: appointment.
Because we don't know when another event type will be added, we prefer to design
this endpoint like this so that we won't need to apply any change in the near future.

There're two options at the moment for this filter: Appointment and Standard.
`Appointment` will return the filters that can be applied on events of type Appointment
and `Standard` will return filters that can be applied on all kind of events

This filter is not required at the moment and will return the filters for the
eventType `Standard`, which is consider as the reference for this endpoint.

get.description: Get the list of all notifications.

parameters.description: Filter to restrict to read/unread notifications

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Filter to restrict to notifications created after given datetime.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Filter to restrict to notifications created before given datetime.

* If the token already exists for the requesting user, updates its last_updated field.
* If the token already exists for a different user, deletes the token from his user and adds it to the requesting user.

204.description: Successfully added token to the user's list of tokens.

get.summary: Get the details of a product, a product master or a bundle
get.description:
This endpoint allows you to get the full details about a product, a master or a bundle.

## Attributes

Attributes are the values configurable for a product.

For a master, the attributes are given without specifying their values.

For a bundle, the attributes are grouped by elements of the bundle.

## Properties

Properties are values not configurable, like descriptions.
```

parameters.name: shopId
parameters.description: The ID of the shop from which the call is made. This ID is used to retrieve stock availability for this given shop. If no shop ID will be given, the response won't include availability & pricing details.

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: The currency to return the product prices in. If no currency code will be given, the response won't include pricing details.

parameters.name: ignoreNotFoundErrors
parameters.description: Specify whether you want to still get data in the response if some of the provided product ids are not existing in the product catalog.

parameters.name: productIdsOrUpcs
parameters.description: An array or a single value of a product, master or bundle code or upc.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description:
An object defining the selected attributes and their corresponding values.
````
  attributes= {
    "size": "12",
    "color": "red"
  }
```
Each key of this object is an attribute of the current master product, which should help to display in the FE, a list of relevant products.
Each key of this attributes query parameter can only receive one value, not an array. In case more than one value is provided, a BadRequestError will be thrown.
Another thing to know is that, you can't populate these attributes with more than one product id. If you do that, a BadRequestError will be thrown.

get.summary: DEPRECATED - Get possible values for attributes of a product master or a bundle.
get.description:
**DEPRECATED** This endpoint will be removed in a future release.

This endpoint can be used to get the possible values of attributes of a product master,
given values for a set of attributes.

When the given selection of attributes gives a single product, the product ID is returned.

For each attribute selected in the request, the list of possible values when this attribute is unselected are given. 

For example, it can be used to get all the possible sizes of products for a given master, with a *blue* color and a *gold* material.

```
selectedAttributes={
  ATTRIBUTE1:VALUE1,
  ATTRIBUTE2:VALUE2
}
```

parameters.name: shopId
parameters.description: the ID of the shop from which the call is made. This ID is used to retrieve stock availability for this given shop.

parameters.name: masterId
parameters.description: master or bundle id

parameters.name: selectedAttributes
parameters.description:
Values of attributes already selected for this master.

This parameter is an object and its style is `form` (by default), the data will be serialized before being sent to the backend.

More on data serialization: https://swagger.io/docs/specification/serialization/

This example data will be serialized as `color=blue&material=gold`

get.summary: Get list of products
get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of products. Free text search, filter by category and filter by attributes can be combined.

parameters.name: shopId
parameters.description: the ID of the shop from which the call is made. This ID is used to retrieve stock availability for this given shop.

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: the currency to return the product prices in

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Free text search

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Select products belonging to this category only

parameters.name: fetchSubcategories
parameters.description: Set to true if you want to fetch the products from the subcategories.

parameters.name: similarTo
parameters.description: Used to search products similar to a given product. `similarTo` indicates the `id` of the product for which to search similar products.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
```
filters={
  ATTRIBUTE1 : { "operator" : OPERATOR1, "value" : VALUE1 },
  ATTRIBUTE2 : { "operator" : OPERATOR2, "value" : VALUE2 }
}
```

`OPERATOR` can be `eq` or `in`.

`VALUE` can be a single value with `eq` operator or an array of values with `in` operator.

The `filters` parameter is an object and its style is `form` (by default), the data will be serialized before being sent to the backend.

More on data serialization: https://swagger.io/docs/specification/serialization/

> This example data will be serialized as:

> ```
> color[operator]=eq&
> color[value]=blue&
> material[operator]=in&
> material[value]=yellow gold&
> material[value]=pink gold
> ```

When the operator is "eq", any request that includes more than one value is treated as a bad request.

parameters.name: sortKey
parameters.description: The key identifying which sort option to apply to the results (e.g. name_asc, price_desc, etc.)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The amount of result to receive in one query

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: The index of the page to query. Counting starts from 0

get.summary: Get list of sub-categories of a category
get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of sub-categories of a given category.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: The ID of the category you want to get the sub-categories.

get.summary: Get the stock details for a product
get.description:
This endpoint allows you to get the full details about stocks for a product.
```

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: product code

parameters.name: shopId
parameters.description: the ID of the shop from which the call is made. This ID is used to retrieve stocks for this given shop.

ProductAvailabilityTag.description:
A value representing a small set of information about the availability of a product
including a title for display and a hex value to use as an accent color.

reason.description: In case of a failure, contains a short description of the problem

success.description: The outcome of the event, set to either "true" or "false".

GetNotificationsRegistrationsTokensRespo.title: GetNotificationsRegistrationsTokensResponse

The response contains all of the Notification Token objects that are attached to the user who's making the request.
* The tokens in the list might be expired.

name.description: The name that needs to be used by the FE in the query parameter selection.

isSelected.description: Defines whether the attribute has been selected or not

type.description: The type which will help the FE team to parse and display the value.

name.description: The name that needs to be used by the FE in the query parameter selection.

isSelected.description: Defines whether the attribute has been selected or not

value.description: a string representation of the attribute for display purposes

ProductVideo.description: An object that holds the product video

url.description: The URL of the product video

thumbnail.description: A custom thumbnail to use for the product video

hasSimilarProducts.description: A boolean that indicates whether or not the current product has similar products.
A boolean that indicates whether or not the current product has similar products.

shortDescription.example: A short description about the product
A short description about the product

isAvailable.description:
Defines whether this stock item is available or not in the associated region.
In privacy-aware situations, a user might want to show a more generic version of
availability instead of a concrete number of items. This value enables the
display of an in-stock/out-of-stock interface.

Defines whether this stock item is available or not in the associated region.
In privacy-aware situations, a user might want to show a more generic version of
availability instead of a concrete number of items. This value enables the
display of an in-stock/out-of-stock interface.

ProductFilterRequestConstraint.description: A constraint placed on a filter. Constraints can either be "in" (an array) or "equals" (to a value).

ProductFilterRequestQueryParameter.description: A set of constraints placed on filters, keyed by the filter name, and containg an operator and an array of values.

ProductsDetailsResult.title: ProductsDetailsResult
ProductsDetailsResult.description: A response when requesting for an array of product ids.

orderId.description: The ID of the order that was created.

PaymentLinkCreationResponse.description: Response used when the server will return a 201 Created

GetPaymentLinkResponse.description: Response used when a server will return a 200 OK for retrieving a payment link

GetNotificationsRegistrationsTokens.description: Successfully fetched tokens from the user's list of tokens.

AppointmentFilterTerritoryOwnerId.name: territoryOwnerId
AppointmentFilterTerritoryOwnerId.description: The territory owner ID of the territory at which the appointment will take place. If the appointment is virtual, the territory ID will be the same territory in which the advisor is working at.

AppointmentFilterTerritoryId.name: territoryId
AppointmentFilterTerritoryId.description: The territory ID at which the appointment will take place. If the appointment is virtual, the territory ID will be the same territory in which the advisor is working at.

AppointmentFilterStartDate.name: startDate
AppointmentFilterStartDate.description: The date representation of the appointment's starting time.

AppointmentFilterEndDate.name: endDate
AppointmentFilterEndDate.description: The date representation of the appointment's ending time.

AcceptLanguage.name: Accept-Language
AcceptLanguage.description:
The returned content's expected language. 
The format is defined by RFC-4646: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4646
If the server is unable to honour this language it will return the content in the default language.

PageIndexQueryParam.name: pageIndex
PageIndexQueryParam.description: The index of the page to query. Counting starts from 0

PageSizeQueryParam.name: pageSize
PageSizeQueryParam.description: The amount of result to receive in one query. Minimum - 200

CursorQueryParam.name: cursor
CursorQueryParam.description: A cursor to keep track of pagination data in case changes were made after fetching results.

SortQueryParam.name: sort
SortQueryParam.description: Clientlist members sorting preferences. The following example will be translated to `sort[key]=name&sort[order]=asc`

ConnectLinkExternalIdPathParam.name: externalId
ConnectLinkExternalIdPathParam.description: Id for which the link has been created.

ConnectLinkExternalIdsPathParam.name: externalIds
ConnectLinkExternalIdsPathParam.description: Ids for which the links were created.

StoreId.name: shopId
StoreId.description: The ID of the shop from which the call is made. This ID is used to retrieve stock availability for this given shop. If no shop ID will be given, the response won't include availability & pricing details.

filtersQueryParam.name: filters

OutreachChannelsQueryParam.name: channels
OutreachChannelsQueryParam.description: The types of channels you'd like to receive

PageSizeQueryParam1.name: pageSize
PageSizeQueryParam1.description: The amount of result to receive in one query.

PaymentNotificationWebhookBody.description: **(ADYEN v67)** The webhook's body structure. This is being designed by the payment service provider.

RegisterToNotificationsBody.description: The body of a request that contains a firebase device token, in JSON format.
